New Records: The Chicago White Sox tied the American League record with 21 losses in a row this summer.
Key Match Events: The White Sox lost 4-3 in 13 innings to the Los Angeles Angels on September 18, 2024.
Post-Match Reflections: White Sox general manager Chris Getz expressed surprise at the team's poor performance, stating he did not foresee the squad challenging the record for most losses in a season.
Chris Getz remains optimistic about the future, stating that the team's struggles will make future successes sweeter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox are close to breaking the record for most losses in a single season, which is 120 losses set by the New York Mets in 1962.
The 2024 White Sox opened the season with a 3-22 record.
No player on the current White Sox roster with over 45 at-bats is hitting over .250, and no pitcher has double digits in wins.
The White Sox fired manager Pedro Grifol after snapping their 21-game losing streak and replaced him with Grady Sizemore.
